dismissalText.commentary: Aizaz Khan b Usman Shinwari 27 (47b 2x4 1x6) SR: 57.44

dismissalComment.html: bowled im! A cracker of a ball too. Quick. Pitched-up. And almost insanely - it darts in off the pitch. There is sideways movement in the UAE! Usman puts everything he has into this, a bolt upright seam helping it to change direction after kissing the surface. Aizaz is slow to come forward. He leaves a big gap as he tries to defend and the ball hurtles through it. Exceptional bowling

dismissalText.long: c Shadab Khan b Hasan Ali
dismissalText.commentary: Kinchit Shah c Shadab Khan b Hasan Ali 26 (50b 1x4 0x6) SR: 52

dismissalComment.html: finds backward point and that is the last specialist batsman gone. Kinchit's vigil ends tamely. It's a length ball utside off, he looks to slice it on the rise but it ends up stopping on him and he can only lob it for Shadab. A good knock that less than three overs ago seemed to have rescued his team. But the slide seems unstoppable now

dismissalComment.html: plumb in front as Usman goes for the yorker. McKechnie shuffles all the way across his stumps and falls over while playing the flick. He misses. The ball thuds into his pads, perfectly in line with middle. Umpire Shah raises the finger but the two Hong Kong batsmen come up to discuss taking a review, but they take way too long to make the sign

headshotImage.caption: Tanwir Afzal player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Tanwir Afzal player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: off stump takes a beating. It's too quick. It's perfectly on target. And what can a tail-ender do against something so menacing. Afzal barely presents a shot to it, stuck in the crease, poking his bat out almost in apology. Another sensational indipper from round the wicket

dismissalText.commentary: Nizakat Khan run out (Shadab Khan) 13 (11b 2x4 0x6) SR: 118.18

dismissalComment.html: run-out appeal and Nizakat doesn't look confident here. At the striker's end. It was his call. And he's out! He's looking to avoid the throw in case it misses the stumps, and as a result, he has neither grounded the bat nor put in a dive. Evasive action, bat hanging in the air, so are his feet. Point's throw knocks the stumps down and after a good start, Nizakat has found a way to go. The run was on, and he really should have made it. Rath had dropped a length ball into the off side with soft hands. The calling was good too. Poor from Nizakat.

dismissalText.commentary: Anshy Rath c Sarfaraz Ahmed b Faheem Ashraf 19 (34b 3x4 0x6) SR: 55.88

dismissalComment.html: got him! Rath's early penchant for hanging the bat inside the line has returned and cost him his wicket. Slightly short of a length from Faheem, pushed across the corridor. Rath has barely moved across from his leg stump guard as he looks to run this down to third man. A thin edge, carries nicely to the keeper

dismissalText.long: st Sarfaraz Ahmed b Shadab Khan
dismissalText.commentary: Babar Hayat st Sarfaraz Ahmed b Shadab Khan 7 (29b 0x4 0x6) SR: 24.13

dismissalComment.html: stumped by a mile. The perfect introduction for Shadab Khan in this Asia Cup. Dribbles out his googly. The batsman doesn't pick it. He's charging out of his crease to hammer the ball over the top. But when it spins in, he's desperately out of place. Goes through with his shot, gets beaten on the inside edge and Sarfraz does the rest. Simple. Too simple.

dismissalText.commentary: Ehsan Khan lbw b Shadab Khan 0 (2b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: traps him lbw! And it's the googly again. He's ridiculously accurate with that ball, pitching it on a length just outside off. Ehsan thinks it's a legbreak again and goes back to deal with it, but when it breaks in, he's panicking. He ends up flicking across the line, deep in his crease, and is struck in line with middle stump

dismissalText.commentary: Ehsan Nawaz run out (sub [Mohammad Nawaz]/Hasan Ali/Sarfaraz Ahmed) 9 (21b 1x4 0x6) SR: 42.85

dismissalComment.html: there's a good chance Pakistan might have missed two run-out opportunities off the same ball...nope, they've got the wicket. A length ball on leg stump, tapped to mid-on. Both batsmen down the pitch, not sure which one said no, but they were both running back. Mid-on missed the chance at the non-striker's end, but the bowler, who was backing up, gathered the ball and chucked it gently towards' Sarfraz who had plenty of time by the end of this strange sequence

commentTextItems.html: launches a short ball to the midwicket boundary and seals a comprehensive win for Pakistan

commentPostTextItems.html: Right, we're done for the night. Do join us again same time on Monday when Sri Lanka face Afghanistan in what is virtually a must-win game for them.

Usman Khan is Man of the Match for his 3 for 19. "When I came to bowl, I just tried to take a wicket with the new ball. But luck was not with me today. In the second spell, I tried, and with the ball reversing, I was able to take wickets. Fitness is okay. There was just a little bit of bleeding in the toe. I'm happy with my bowling today and it's given me lots of confidence. It's fun to play with a lot of strong players on the bench, all of us are good bowlers, we compete against each other and hopefully we can keep going forward and trying hard"

"This was a complete performance. But as captain I saw a couple of things, we'll work on that as well," Pakistan captain Sarfraz Ahmed says, "For us to go the distance in the tournament, we should have won this game by nine wickets. We also need to get early wickets with the ball. Early on, the ball didn't swing and we had alarm bells. We have time to adjust to this before the India game. It's good to win, but to win against India, we have to be at our very best"
ESPNcricinfo Match Day is live on the homepage. Go there to check in with Deep Dasgupta and Saqlain Mushtaq

"Lots of soft dismissals. 120 [116] was not enough. It was a good wicket. Credit goes to the Pakistan bowlers," Hong Kong captain Anshy Rath says, "Our offspinners are top class, but we just didn't have enough runs on the board. I think early on, it swung a bit, there was a bit of bounce. We got through the start, but we couldn't convert it. One fifty-run partnership is not enough to post a good total"

9.00 pm Pakistan's bowling strength - it can't be overstated. Usman Khan picks up three wickets in an over. Shadab Khan struck with his first ball, an absolutely delicious googly. Mohammad Amir was tidy, if not quite threatening and Hasan Ali attacks the stumps with such a vengeance. It was always going to be hard for Hong Kong and once they folded for 116, there was only ever going to be one result at the end of the night. Former Pakistan offspinner Saqlain Mushtaq said this game would just be preparation for the one against India. But was it even that?

commentTextItems.html: clips it off his hips through to deep square leg. Brings up fifty, his first, in addition to his four previous hundreds in ODIs
blocks to point, looking for the run that gets him a fifty. Not there
opens the face to plop a ball on off stump into the sprawling real estate at third man
one-bounce into the long-on ropes. Imam is on 49, getting there with an eager couple of steps down the pitch and a launch over the bowler's head

commentTextItems.html: full on off stump, defends
this time the flick works, the length ball on middle scurrying away in front of square leg
appeal for lbw, but Malik gets an inside edge as he goes for a flick
slips down leg
nudges the ball straying on leg to long leg
flicks the full delivery on leg stump to deep midwicket
flicks it off his pads to deep square leg

commentTextItems.html: defends the back of a length ball to short midwicket

commentPostTextItems.html: The umpires thought the over was done, forgetting about the wide call they made. Eventually, it's put right

abdulla: "I don't know why there is so much critic going on about Imam. He has so far only played in conditions in which things are calm or there is a requirement of a cool head.( Ireland Test). He just doesn't have to attack when things are going right. Just imagine, if today He was also gone today playing big shots, there would be more pressure on Pakistan and it would be considered a strong fought win. Also, then we would not be able to say that Pakistan are going at a cruise mode. Reminds me of Misbah"

commentTextItems.html: bouncer, he ignores it
back of a length on leg stump, works it behind square leg

commentPostTextItems.html: Owais: "@apple you're talking about a kid who hasn't had many home matches, with the crowd cheering him on (no UAE is not Pakistan) and who has proven to be the cause of cornerstone of the overall ODI improvement of Pakistan. Give him a break"

Mudassir Butt : "Everything pointing towards a classic Ind-Pak match...India coming straight from England Series and Pakistani Players getting match practice...I have taken leave on Wednesday to watch Cricket's El Clasico"

commentTextItems.html: full and outside off, drives to mid-off

wallops it over long-on! For half a second, it seems like he's been done in by the bowler responding to his charge out of the crease. But Imam meets the short ball head on and pulls it away ever so strongly
comes down the pitch but Nawaz adjusts to it, going for a bouncer. Too high says the umpire
goes back to block through point, and since there's only vacant spaces there...

dismissalText.commentary: Nizakat Khan run out (Shadab Khan) 13 (11b 2x4 0x6) SR: 118.18

dismissalComment.html: run-out appeal and Nizakat doesn't look confident here. At the striker's end. It was his call. And he's out! He's looking to avoid the throw in case it misses the stumps, and as a result, he has neither grounded the bat nor put in a dive. Evasive action, bat hanging in the air, so are his feet. Point's throw knocks the stumps down and after a good start, Nizakat has found a way to go. The run was on, and he really should have made it. Rath had dropped a length ball into the off side with soft hands. The calling was good too. Poor from Nizakat.

dismissalText.commentary: Anshy Rath c Sarfaraz Ahmed b Faheem Ashraf 19 (34b 3x4 0x6) SR: 55.88

dismissalComment.html: got him! Rath's early penchant for hanging the bat inside the line has returned and cost him his wicket. Slightly short of a length from Faheem, pushed across the corridor. Rath has barely moved across from his leg stump guard as he looks to run this down to third man. A thin edge, carries nicely to the keeper

dismissalText.long: st Sarfaraz Ahmed b Shadab Khan
dismissalText.commentary: Babar Hayat st Sarfaraz Ahmed b Shadab Khan 7 (29b 0x4 0x6) SR: 24.13

dismissalComment.html: stumped by a mile. The perfect introduction for Shadab Khan in this Asia Cup. Dribbles out his googly. The batsman doesn't pick it. He's charging out of his crease to hammer the ball over the top. But when it spins in, he's desperately out of place. Goes through with his shot, gets beaten on the inside edge and Sarfraz does the rest. Simple. Too simple.

dismissalText.long: c Shadab Khan b Hasan Ali
dismissalText.commentary: Kinchit Shah c Shadab Khan b Hasan Ali 26 (50b 1x4 0x6) SR: 52

dismissalComment.html: finds backward point and that is the last specialist batsman gone. Kinchit's vigil ends tamely. It's a length ball utside off, he looks to slice it on the rise but it ends up stopping on him and he can only lob it for Shadab. A good knock that less than three overs ago seemed to have rescued his team. But the slide seems unstoppable now

dismissalText.commentary: Ehsan Khan lbw b Shadab Khan 0 (2b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: traps him lbw! And it's the googly again. He's ridiculously accurate with that ball, pitching it on a length just outside off. Ehsan thinks it's a legbreak again and goes back to deal with it, but when it breaks in, he's panicking. He ends up flicking across the line, deep in his crease, and is struck in line with middle stump

dismissalText.commentary: Aizaz Khan b Usman Shinwari 27 (47b 2x4 1x6) SR: 57.44

dismissalComment.html: bowled im! A cracker of a ball too. Quick. Pitched-up. And almost insanely - it darts in off the pitch. There is sideways movement in the UAE! Usman puts everything he has into this, a bolt upright seam helping it to change direction after kissing the surface. Aizaz is slow to come forward. He leaves a big gap as he tries to defend and the ball hurtles through it. Exceptional bowling

dismissalText.commentary: Scott McKechnie lbw b Usman Shinwari 0 (3b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: plumb in front as Usman goes for the yorker. McKechnie shuffles all the way across his stumps and falls over while playing the flick. He misses. The ball thuds into his pads, perfectly in line with middle. Umpire Shah raises the finger but the two Hong Kong batsmen come up to discuss taking a review, but they take way too long to make the sign

dismissalText.commentary: Tanwir Afzal b Usman Shinwari 0 (1b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0

dismissalText.commentary: Ehsan Nawaz run out (sub [Mohammad Nawaz]/Hasan Ali/Sarfaraz Ahmed) 9 (21b 1x4 0x6) SR: 42.85

dismissalComment.html: there's a good chance Pakistan might have missed two run-out opportunities off the same ball...nope, they've got the wicket. A length ball on leg stump, tapped to mid-on. Both batsmen down the pitch, not sure which one said no, but they were both running back. Mid-on missed the chance at the non-striker's end, but the bowler, who was backing up, gathered the ball and chucked it gently towards' Sarfraz who had plenty of time by the end of this strange sequence

dismissalText.commentary: Scott McKechnie lbw b Usman Shinwari 0 (3b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: plumb in front as Usman goes for the yorker. McKechnie shuffles all the way across his stumps and falls over while playing the flick. He misses. The ball thuds into his pads, perfectly in line with middle. Umpire Shah raises the finger but the two Hong Kong batsmen come up to discuss taking a review, but they take way too long to make the sign

headshotImage.longCaption: Usman Shinwari player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Tanwir Afzal b Usman Shinwari 0 (1b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: off stump takes a beating. It's too quick. It's perfectly on target. And what can a tail-ender do against something so menacing. Afzal barely presents a shot to it, stuck in the crease, poking his bat out almost in apology. Another sensational indipper from round the wicket

dismissalText.long: c Shadab Khan b Hasan Ali
dismissalText.commentary: Kinchit Shah c Shadab Khan b Hasan Ali 26 (50b 1x4 0x6) SR: 52

dismissalComment.html: finds backward point and that is the last specialist batsman gone. Kinchit's vigil ends tamely. It's a length ball utside off, he looks to slice it on the rise but it ends up stopping on him and he can only lob it for Shadab. A good knock that less than three overs ago seemed to have rescued his team. But the slide seems unstoppable now

headshotImage.longCaption: Sarfaraz Ahmed headshot

dismissalText.commentary: Ehsan Nawaz run out (sub [Mohammad Nawaz]/Hasan Ali/Sarfaraz Ahmed) 9 (21b 1x4 0x6) SR: 42.85

dismissalComment.html: there's a good chance Pakistan might have missed two run-out opportunities off the same ball...nope, they've got the wicket. A length ball on leg stump, tapped to mid-on. Both batsmen down the pitch, not sure which one said no, but they were both running back. Mid-on missed the chance at the non-striker's end, but the bowler, who was backing up, gathered the ball and chucked it gently towards' Sarfraz who had plenty of time by the end of this strange sequence

dismissalText.commentary: Fakhar Zaman c McKechnie b Ehsan Khan 24 (27b 2x4 1x6) SR: 88.88

dismissalComment.html: celebrappeal from Ehsan Khan and umpire Shah yields to it. Zaman has to go, caught behind, and it's a pretty epic grab too. McKechnie ends up having to juggle it a bit - the ball bouncing off his leg and up into his hands - but he does stay in control of the ball, which can't be said about Zaman, who cuts a ball that isn't quite wide enough and gets a bottom edge
